title.narrative: EFFECTIVE SCHOOLS

description.narrative: Strengthened organizational capacity of key stakeholders to design and deliver equitable, inclusive and relevant education services, transitioning strategies and protective learning environments, including in emergencies, for all children and adolescents within rights-based educational frameworks and principles by 2021,which contributes to Adolescent Health And Nutrition, Equitable Access To Quality Education, Equitable Access To Quality Education (Covid), Evaluation And Research, Learning And Child-Friendly Schools, Learning Outcomes, Learning Outcomes (Covid), Skills Development. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021, all boys, girls and adolescents, especially the most disadvantaged among them, have improved their education and developmental outcomes and access equitable and inclusive learning environments across the life cycle, including in emergencies.

mailing-address.narrative: 1st Floor UN House Marine Gardens Christ Church BARBADOS

sector.narrative: Corporate, multi country, multi region and multi outcome evaluations
System strengthening - gender-responsive teaching and learning (excluding SRGBV)
System strengthening - inclusive education for other vulnerable children poorest quintile, ethnic/linguistic minorities, migrant children, non-citizens/undocumented children etc.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Strengthened organizational capacity of key stakeholders to design and deliver equitable, inclusive and relevant education services, transitioning strategies and protective learning environments, including in emergencies, for all children and adolescents within rights-based educational frameworks and principles by 2021

description.narrative: As part of wider mainstreaming of child-centred, right-based education principles in schools, over 38,200 students were reached through the training of over 2,444 teachers and principals in student participation and leadership, school-wide positive behavioural management and student-centred teaching and learning strategies. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:07/01/2020

title.narrative: School age children targeted by UNCEF that have access to psychosocial support in their schools/learning spaces during and after the humanitatrina situation
System Strengthening - Education sector planning - Education Sector Plan or Transitional Education Sector Plan developed with UNICEF support available
(alt) Number of children attending or going to school after reopening of schools [COVID]
Number of children supported with distance/home-based learning [COVIDSitRep]
System Strengthening - Learning assessment - Learning outcomes are measured in all schools supported by UNICEF with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models - score (1-4), see guidance
Existence of a national education strategy/plan that promote equity in terms of access and learning

System Strengthening - Availability, in schools supported by UNICEF, of quality CFS/CFE standards that are consistent with Child Friendly Schools/education or similar models - score (1-4), see guidance
